page.title: 01Tynron and Shinnel Water
page.content: A landscape dominated by sheep farming; higher parts covered with rough grass and bracken, with much improved grassland for hay and silage on lower slopes and valley flats. Some hill cattle, eggs and chicks produced at Lann Hall Hatchery, sheep milked at Kirkland. Variety given by small patches of conifers, a ribbon of mixed woodland along the Shinnel and the famous juniper wood near the ford. Attractive Shinnel Water forms an elbow, with Airdlinn a local beauty spot. Rounded hills up to 335m with crags at Craigturra and Tynron Doon, a Conical hill visible for miles. Two beautiful lochans at Aird and Capenoch. Population of about 60 half living in and around Tynron village, no amenities save a post-box, telephone, village hall and the Kirk used once a month.
